009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
018import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
019import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class is a re-implementation of the "quasi-linear-time" component
024 * tree algorithm which is based on efficient, tree-based union finding as described in [1].
025 * See Section 26.2.2 of [2] for a detailed description (Algs. 26.1 - 26.2).
026 * This algorithm is also used in the original MSER paper by Matas et al. [3].
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] L. Vincent and P. Soille, "Watersheds in digital spaces: An efficient 
030 * algorithm based on immersion simulations", IEEE Transactions on 
031 * Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence 13(6), 583–598 (1991).
032 * <br>
033 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * <br>
035 * [3] J. Matas, O. Chum, M. Urban, and T. Pajdla. Robust widebaseline
036 * stereo from maximally stable extremal regions. Image and Vision Computing 22(10), 
037 * 761–767 (2004).
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 *
042 * @param <T> the type of properties to be attached to components
043 */
044public class ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<T> extends ComponentTree<T> {
045        
046        private final Collection<Component<T>> components;
047        private final Component<T> root;
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor. Creates a new component tree from a {@link PixelMap}
051         * representing a gray-level image.
052         * @param pm a {@link PixelMap}
053         */
054        public ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion(PixelMap pm) {
055                root = collectComponents(pm);
056                components = new ArrayList<>();
057                buildTree();
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        public Component<T> getRoot() {
062                return root;
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        public Collection<Component<T>> getComponents() {
067                return components;
068        }
069        
070        // ------------------------------------------------------------
071        
072        /**
073         * Collects all image pixels (in sorted order) and creates a preliminary
074         * component tree whose root is returned.
075         * 
076         * @param P a {@link PixelMap} (the input image)
077         * @return
078         */
079        private Component<T> collectComponents(PixelMap P) {
080                final Pixel[] Q = P.getPixelVector();
081                Arrays.sort(Q);         // sorts pixels in P by increasing gray-level (value)
082                
083                final ComponentMap<T> C = new ComponentMap<T>(P.width, P.height);
084                Component<T> r = null;                  // root of the component tree
085                
086                for (Pixel p : Q) {
087                        Component<T> cp = C.makeComponent(p); // creates a new sub-tree (with cp as root)
088                        Pixel n = p.getNextNeighbor();
089                        while (n != null) {
090                                Component<T> cn = C.getComponent(n);
091                                if (cn != null) {
092                                        // the neighbor component is already part of a tree)
093                                        // find the associated roots
094                                        Component<T> rp = cp.findRoot();        // root of p
095                                        Component<T> rn = cn.findRoot();        // root of n
096
097                                        if(rp != rn) {  // p and n have different roots
098                                                if (rp.getLevel() == rn.getLevel() &&  rp.getHeight() < rn.getHeight()) {
099                                                        // n's root becomes the parent of p's root
100                                                        join(rp, rn);
101                                                        r = rn;
102                                                } else {
103                                                        // rp.val > rn.val, p' root becomes the parent of n's root
104                                                        join(rn, rp);
105                                                        r = rp;
106                                                }
107                                        }
108                                }       
109                                //else: the neighbor is in no forest, i.e. unprocessed so we don't care
110                                n = p.getNextNeighbor();
111                        }
112                }
113                
114                return r;
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         *  Joins the disjoint trees with root nodes r1 and r2.
119         *  Makes the tree rooted at r1 a sub-tree under root r2, i.e.,
120         *  r1 becomes a child node of r2. Node r2 is the root of
121         *  the joined tree.
122         *  
123         * @param r1 the root of the first (child) sub-tree
124         * @param r2 the root of the second (master) sub-tree
125         */
126        private void join(Component<T> r1, Component<T> r2) {
127                r1.setParent(r2);
128                r2.addChild(r1);
129                r2.addToSize(r1.getSize());
130                r2.setHeight(Math.max(r2.getHeight(), r1.getHeight() + 1));
131        }
132        
133        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
134        
135        /**
136         * Builds the tree starting at the {@link #root} component.
137         */
138        private void buildTree() {
139                // Find all extremal regions and connect them:
140                linkExtremalComponents(root, root);     // fills components
141                //components.addAll(linkExtremalComponents2(root, root));
142                
143                // Reduce the remaining (non-extremal) components
144                // into the associated (ancestor) extremal components:
145                for (Component<T> c : components) {
146                        reduceNonExtremalComponents(c);
147                }
148        }
149        
150        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
151        
152        /**
153         * Recursively links extremal components by omitting intermediate
154         * non-extremal components. Initially applied to the root component.
155         * Collects extremal regions into {@link #components}.
156         * @param c the current component (to be inspected)
157         * @param e the closest extremal component on the ancestor path
158         */
159        private void linkExtremalComponents(Component<T> c, Component<T> e) {
160                if (c.isExtremal()) {
161                        components.add(c);
162                        //System.out.println("          adding " + c.toString() + " extremalRegions.size()=" + extremalRegions.size());
163                        if (c != e) {
164                                c.setParent(e);
165                                e.addChild(c);  // children is a HashSet, i.e., no duplicate entries!
166                        }
167                        e = c;
168                }
169                // do the same for all children
170                for (Component<T> child : new ArrayList<>(c.getChildren())) {// copy needed since recursive call may change the child list
171                        linkExtremalComponents(child, e);
172                }
173        }
174        
175        // Version 2: returns a set of extremal components (book version)
176        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
177        private Collection<Component<T>> linkExtremalComponents2(Component<T> c, Component<T> e) {
178                Collection<Component<T>> E = new LinkedList<>();
179                if (c.isExtremal()) {
180                        E.add(c);
181                        //System.out.println("          adding " + c.toString() + " extremalRegions.size()=" + extremalRegions.size());
182                        if (c != e) {
183                                c.setParent(e);
184                                e.addChild(c);  // children is a HashSet, i.e., no duplicate entries!
185                        }
186                        e = c;
187                }
188                // do the same for all children
189                for (Component<T> child : new ArrayList<>(c.getChildren())) {// copy needed since recursive call may change the child list
190                        E.addAll(linkExtremalComponents2(child, e));
191                }
192                return E;
193        }
194        
195        /**
196         * Eliminates all non-extremal components attached to the given component.
197         * Initially invoked on an extremal component.
198         * All local pixels from a non-extremal child components are collected
199         * and merged to the parent component.
200         * @param c an extremal component
201         */
202        private void reduceNonExtremalComponents(Component<T> c) {
203                if (!c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {               
204                        // visit each child and (if not extremal) collect all its points into c
205                        Iterator<Component<T>> iter = c.getChildren().iterator();
206                        while (iter.hasNext()) {
207                                Component<T> cc = iter.next();
208                                if (!cc.isExtremal()) {
209                                        reduceNonExtremalComponents(cc);                // recursive call
210                                        c.getLocalPixels().addAll(cc.getLocalPixels());
211                                        cc.getLocalPixels().clear();
212                                        iter.remove();  // remove child from c's children
213                                }
214                        }
215                }
216        }
217                
218        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
219        
220        /**
221         * This nested class represents a 2D container for elements of type {@link Component}.
222         * The array is of the same size as the image, with one component for every image pixel.
223         * The array is initially empty, i.e. contains only {@code null} values.
224         * Components are created on demand (by {@link #makeComponent(Pixel)} during building
225         * of the component tree.
226         * The method {@link #getComponent(Pixel)} is used to check if the component for
227         * a specific image point exists.
228
229         * @param <T> the type of data that may be attached to components (e.g., {@link MserData})
230         */
231        private static class ComponentMap<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
232                
233                private final int width, height;
234                private final Object[] compArr;
235                
236                public ComponentMap(int width, int height) {
237                        this.width = width;
238                        this.height = height;
239                        this.compArr = new Object[this.width * this.height];
240                }
241                
242                /**
243                 * Creates and returns a new component for the specified image point.
244                 * An exception is thrown if a component already exists for this
245                 * point.
246                 * @param p the image point
247                 * @return the new component
248                 */
249                public Component<T> makeComponent(Pixel p) {
250                        int idx = width * p.y + p.x;    // unique component index
251                        if (compArr[idx] != null) {
252                                throw new RuntimeException("component already exists for point " + ((PntInt)p).toString());
253                        }
254                        Component<T> c = new Component<>(p.val, idx);
255                        c.addPoint(p);
256                        compArr[idx] = c;
257                        return c;
258                }
259                
260                /**
261                 * Returns the component for the specified image point or
262                 * {@code null} if it does not exist.
263                 * @param p the image point
264                 * @return the associated component or {@code null}
265                 */
266                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
267                public Component<T> getComponent(Pixel p) {
268                        return (Component<T>) compArr[p.y * width + p.x];
269                }
270                
271                /**
272                 * Iterator to loop over all {@link Component} elements of this {@link ComponentMap}.
273                 * Note that this iterator may return null elements!
274                 */
275                @Override
276                public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
277                        return new Iterator<Component<T>>() {
278                                private int pos = 0;
279
280                                @Override
281                                public boolean hasNext() {
282                                        return pos < compArr.length;
283                                }
284
285                                @Override
286                                public Component<T> next() {
287                                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
288                                        Component<T> c = (Component<T>) compArr[pos];
289                                        pos++;
290                                        return c;
291                                }
292                        };
293                }
294
295        }
296        
297}
